trans-unit.source: Step 5: Create and Deploy the EDI Receive Pipeline
trans-unit.target: Step 5: Create and Deploy the EDI Receive Pipeline

trans-unit.source: In this topic, you configure the EDI Receive <token>bridge</token> that receives an X12 850 PO message from an FTP server, processes it, transforms it to an ORDERS05 IDOC, and then routes it to the <token>one-way</token> that you deployed in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: In this topic, you configure the EDI Receive <token>bridge</token> that receives an X12 850 PO message from an FTP server, processes it, transforms it to an ORDERS05 IDOC, and then routes it to the <token>one-way</token> that you deployed in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: To configure an EDI Receive pipeline
trans-unit.target: To configure an EDI Receive pipeline

trans-unit.source: Log into the <token>tpm_portal</token>.
trans-unit.target: Log into the <token>tpm_portal</token>.

trans-unit.source: You can get the URL for the <token>tpm_portal</token> from your <token>af_integration</token> subscription.
trans-unit.target: You can get the URL for the <token>tpm_portal</token> from your <token>af_integration</token> subscription.

trans-unit.source: For more information about logging into the portal, see <externalLink><linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=317714</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=317714</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about logging into the portal, see <externalLink><linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=317714</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=317714</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Create a partner for <embeddedLabel>Fabrikam</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Contoso</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Create a partner for <embeddedLabel>Fabrikam</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Contoso</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: On the left pane, select <embeddedLabel>Partners</embeddedLabel>, and then from the <embeddedLabel>Partners</embeddedLabel> page, select <embeddedLabel>Add Partner</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: On the left pane, select <embeddedLabel>Partners</embeddedLabel>, and then from the <embeddedLabel>Partners</embeddedLabel> page, select <embeddedLabel>Add Partner</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Create an agreement between the two partners.
trans-unit.target: Create an agreement between the two partners.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Agreements</embeddedLabel> page, select the <embeddedLabel>EDI</embeddedLabel> tab if you are not already on that tab.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Agreements</embeddedLabel> page, select the <embeddedLabel>EDI</embeddedLabel> tab if you are not already on that tab.

trans-unit.source: Then click <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Then click <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Set the following values for the <embeddedLabel>General Settings</embeddedLabel> tab.
trans-unit.target: Set the following values for the <embeddedLabel>General Settings</embeddedLabel> tab.

trans-unit.source: Field
trans-unit.target: Field

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Enter a name for the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name for the agreement.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, enter <userInput>SAPIntegration</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, enter <userInput>SAPIntegration</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: This is a mandatory field.
trans-unit.target: This is a mandatory field.

trans-unit.source: The name for the agreement must be unique.
trans-unit.target: The name for the agreement must be unique.

trans-unit.source: Protocol
trans-unit.target: Protocol

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>X12</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>X12</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Enter notes or a description for the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Enter notes or a description for the agreement.

trans-unit.source: Hosted Partner
trans-unit.target: Hosted Partner

trans-unit.source: Select the hosted partner for the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Select the hosted partner for the agreement.

trans-unit.source: A hosted partner is a partner managed by the service provider and the pipelines are deployed for that partner during agreement deployment.
trans-unit.target: A hosted partner is a partner managed by the service provider and the pipelines are deployed for that partner during agreement deployment.

trans-unit.source: Typically partners managed by service provider are configured as a hosted partner while the enterprise partners are guest partners.
trans-unit.target: Typically partners managed by service provider are configured as a hosted partner while the enterprise partners are guest partners.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, the hosted partner is <embeddedLabel>Fabrikam</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, the hosted partner is <embeddedLabel>Fabrikam</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The default profile for Fabrikam is displayed in the <embeddedLabel>Profile</embeddedLabel> field.
trans-unit.target: The default profile for Fabrikam is displayed in the <embeddedLabel>Profile</embeddedLabel> field.

trans-unit.source: Guest Partner
trans-unit.target: Guest Partner

trans-unit.source: Select the partner for the agreement (who is not a hosted partner).
trans-unit.target: Select the partner for the agreement (who is not a hosted partner).

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, select <embeddedLabel>Contoso</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, select <embeddedLabel>Contoso</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The default profile for Contoso is displayed in the <embeddedLabel>Profile</embeddedLabel> field.
trans-unit.target: The default profile for Contoso is displayed in the <embeddedLabel>Profile</embeddedLabel> field.

trans-unit.source: Identities
trans-unit.target: Identities

trans-unit.source: Hosted Partner ID Qualifier
trans-unit.target: Hosted Partner ID Qualifier

trans-unit.source: Select an authenticating qualifier that provides unique business identities to the trading partners.
trans-unit.target: Select an authenticating qualifier that provides unique business identities to the trading partners.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, select <embeddedLabel>ZZ-Mutually Defined</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, select <embeddedLabel>ZZ-Mutually Defined</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Enter <userInput>FABRIKAM</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Enter <userInput>FABRIKAM</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Guest Partner ID Qualifier
trans-unit.target: Guest Partner ID Qualifier

trans-unit.source: Select an authenticating qualifier that provides unique business identities to the trading partners.
trans-unit.target: Select an authenticating qualifier that provides unique business identities to the trading partners.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, select <embeddedLabel>ZZ-Mutually Defined</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, select <embeddedLabel>ZZ-Mutually Defined</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Enter <userInput>CONTOSO</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Enter <userInput>CONTOSO</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Tracking
trans-unit.target: Tracking

trans-unit.source: Track Send side message properties
trans-unit.target: Track Send side message properties

trans-unit.source: Check this to store the message properties when the EDI message is sent to the partner.
trans-unit.target: Check this to store the message properties when the EDI message is sent to the partner.

trans-unit.source: Once stored, you can query this data by clicking <embeddedLabel>Tracking</embeddedLabel> on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page.
trans-unit.target: Once stored, you can query this data by clicking <embeddedLabel>Tracking</embeddedLabel> on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page.

trans-unit.source: When enabled, you can also store the message body by checking <ui>Archive Send side message</ui>.
trans-unit.target: When enabled, you can also store the message body by checking <ui>Archive Send side message</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Track Receive side message properties
trans-unit.target: Track Receive side message properties

trans-unit.source: Check this to store the message properties when the EDI message is received from a partner.
trans-unit.target: Check this to store the message properties when the EDI message is received from a partner.

trans-unit.source: Once stored, you can query this data by clicking <embeddedLabel>Tracking</embeddedLabel> on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page.
trans-unit.target: Once stored, you can query this data by clicking <embeddedLabel>Tracking</embeddedLabel> on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page.

trans-unit.source: When enabled, you can also store the message body by checking <ui>Archive Receive side message</ui>.
trans-unit.target: When enabled, you can also store the message body by checking <ui>Archive Receive side message</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>Continue</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>Continue</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Selecting <embeddedLabel>Continue</embeddedLabel> adds two new tabs: one for receive settings and the other for send settings.
trans-unit.target: Selecting <embeddedLabel>Continue</embeddedLabel> adds two new tabs: one for receive settings and the other for send settings.

trans-unit.source: Each tab is for a one-way agreement between the two partners, one for receiving messages and the other for sending messages.
trans-unit.target: Each tab is for a one-way agreement between the two partners, one for receiving messages and the other for sending messages.

trans-unit.source: The properties in the <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> tab define how the EDI receive bridge is configured.
trans-unit.target: The properties in the <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> tab define how the EDI receive bridge is configured.

trans-unit.source: This bridge receives incoming EDI messages that are sent to Fabrikam.
trans-unit.target: This bridge receives incoming EDI messages that are sent to Fabrikam.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, the properties in the <embeddedLabel>Send Settings</embeddedLabel> tab define how the EDI send bridge is configured.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, the properties in the <embeddedLabel>Send Settings</embeddedLabel> tab define how the EDI send bridge is configured.

trans-unit.source: This bridge sends EDI messages from Fabrikam to its trading partners like Contoso.
trans-unit.target: This bridge sends EDI messages from Fabrikam to its trading partners like Contoso.

trans-unit.source: To specify the receive settings
trans-unit.target: To specify the receive settings

trans-unit.source: From the agreements page, select the <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> tab.
trans-unit.target: From the agreements page, select the <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> tab.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following values for the <embeddedLabel>Transport</embeddedLabel> section:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following values for the <embeddedLabel>Transport</embeddedLabel> section:

trans-unit.source: For <embeddedLabel>Transport Type</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>FTP</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For <embeddedLabel>Transport Type</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>FTP</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the scenario used in this tutorial, Contoso sends the X12 850 message using an FTP location.
trans-unit.target: In the scenario used in this tutorial, Contoso sends the X12 850 message using an FTP location.

trans-unit.source: Provide the name of the FTP Server from where the messages are picked.
trans-unit.target: Provide the name of the FTP Server from where the messages are picked.

trans-unit.source: Enter the username and password to connect to the FTP Server.
trans-unit.target: Enter the username and password to connect to the FTP Server.

trans-unit.source: Enter the relative path on the server from where to pick the X12 850 message.
trans-unit.target: Enter the relative path on the server from where to pick the X12 850 message.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following values for the <embeddedLabel>Protocol</embeddedLabel> section:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following values for the <embeddedLabel>Protocol</embeddedLabel> section:

trans-unit.source: Enter whether you want to receive technical (TA1) and functional acknowledgements (997).
trans-unit.target: Enter whether you want to receive technical (TA1) and functional acknowledgements (997).

trans-unit.source: Under <embeddedLabel>Schemas</embeddedLabel>, select the plus sign and specify the following values:
trans-unit.target: Under <embeddedLabel>Schemas</embeddedLabel>, select the plus sign and specify the following values:

trans-unit.source: For this
trans-unit.target: For this

trans-unit.source: Specify this
trans-unit.target: Specify this

trans-unit.source: For <embeddedLabel>Version</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: For <embeddedLabel>Version</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: Specify <embeddedLabel>00401</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Specify <embeddedLabel>00401</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: For <embeddedLabel>Transaction Type (ST1)</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: For <embeddedLabel>Transaction Type (ST1)</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: Specify <embeddedLabel>850 – Purchase Order</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Specify <embeddedLabel>850 – Purchase Order</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: For <embeddedLabel>Sender Application (GS02)</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: For <embeddedLabel>Sender Application (GS02)</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: Specify <userInput>CONTOSO</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Specify <userInput>CONTOSO</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: For <embeddedLabel>Schema</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: For <embeddedLabel>Schema</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: From the drop-down list, select the schema (X12_00401_850.xsd).
trans-unit.target: From the drop-down list, select the schema (X12_00401_850.xsd).

trans-unit.source: This schema was uploaded to your <token>af_integration</token> when you deployed the <token>msgflow_proj</token> in the last step.
trans-unit.target: This schema was uploaded to your <token>af_integration</token> when you deployed the <token>msgflow_proj</token> in the last step.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Transform</embeddedLabel> section, select the plus sign to add a transform to the agreement.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Transform</embeddedLabel> section, select the plus sign to add a transform to the agreement.

trans-unit.source: From the drop-down list, select the X12_00401_850.xsd schema and the transform you created earlier (AzureTransformations.trfm).
trans-unit.target: From the drop-down list, select the X12_00401_850.xsd schema and the transform you created earlier (AzureTransformations.trfm).

trans-unit.source: The schema as well as the transform is deployed to the <token>af_integration</token> subscription when you deployed the <token>msgflow_proj</token> in the previous step:
trans-unit.target: The schema as well as the transform is deployed to the <token>af_integration</token> subscription when you deployed the <token>msgflow_proj</token> in the previous step:

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Route</embeddedLabel> page, under <embeddedLabel>Route Settings</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> to add a route destination.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Route</embeddedLabel> page, under <embeddedLabel>Route Settings</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> to add a route destination.

trans-unit.source: Set the <embeddedLabel>Rule Name</embeddedLabel> to <userInput>SendToBridge</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Set the <embeddedLabel>Rule Name</embeddedLabel> to <userInput>SendToBridge</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Under <embeddedLabel>Route rule</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Use advanced definitions</embeddedLabel>, and enter the following expression in the text box:
trans-unit.target: Under <embeddedLabel>Route rule</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Use advanced definitions</embeddedLabel>, and enter the following expression in the text box:

trans-unit.source: This expression always resolves to true, which means that all the messages are routed to the <token>bridge</token>.
trans-unit.target: This expression always resolves to true, which means that all the messages are routed to the <token>bridge</token>.

trans-unit.source: Even if you do not select the <embeddedLabel>Use advanced definitions</embeddedLabel> option and do not provide any route rule, by default this option is selected and its value is set to <embeddedLabel>1=1</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Even if you do not select the <embeddedLabel>Use advanced definitions</embeddedLabel> option and do not provide any route rule, by default this option is selected and its value is set to <embeddedLabel>1=1</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: This means that the default behavior is to route all the messages to the route destination.
trans-unit.target: This means that the default behavior is to route all the messages to the route destination.

trans-unit.source: Under <embeddedLabel>Route action</embeddedLabel>, select the plus sign to add a new row and set the following values:
trans-unit.target: Under <embeddedLabel>Route action</embeddedLabel>, select the plus sign to add a new row and set the following values:

trans-unit.source: Set <embeddedLabel>Target Type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Http Header</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: Set <embeddedLabel>Target Type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Http Header</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: Set <embeddedLabel>Header Name</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Content-Type</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: Set <embeddedLabel>Header Name</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Content-Type</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: Set <embeddedLabel>Value Type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Constant</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: Set <embeddedLabel>Value Type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Constant</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: Set <embeddedLabel>Constant Value</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>application/xml</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: Set <embeddedLabel>Constant Value</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>application/xml</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: This ensures that all the messages that are routed to the <token>bridge</token> include a <embeddedLabel>content-type</embeddedLabel> header with its value set to <embeddedLabel>application/xml</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: This ensures that all the messages that are routed to the <token>bridge</token> include a <embeddedLabel>content-type</embeddedLabel> header with its value set to <embeddedLabel>application/xml</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Without this header, the bridge receiving the message treats it as a flat-file message and might result in validation errors.
trans-unit.target: Without this header, the bridge receiving the message treats it as a flat-file message and might result in validation errors.

trans-unit.source: Under <embeddedLabel>Route destination</embeddedLabel>, set <embeddedLabel>Transport type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Azure BizTalk Bridge</embeddedLabel> and in the text box enter the entity name of the <token>bridge</token> on the message flow surface.
trans-unit.target: Under <embeddedLabel>Route destination</embeddedLabel>, set <embeddedLabel>Transport type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Azure BizTalk Bridge</embeddedLabel> and in the text box enter the entity name of the <token>bridge</token> on the message flow surface.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, you specified the <token>bridge</token> name as <embeddedLabel>B2BConnector</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, you specified the <token>bridge</token> name as <embeddedLabel>B2BConnector</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Using this name the bridge deployment endpoint is built, which is <codeInline>http://<legacyItalic>%%amp;lt;mybiztalkservicename%%amp;gt;</legacyItalic>.biztalk.windows.net/default/<codeFeaturedElement>B2BConnector</codeFeaturedElement></codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Using this name the bridge deployment endpoint is built, which is <codeInline>http://<legacyItalic>%%amp;lt;mybiztalkservicename%%amp;gt;</legacyItalic>.biztalk.windows.net/default/<codeFeaturedElement>B2BConnector</codeFeaturedElement></codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: With this configuration, all the messages processed by the agreement are routed to the <token>one-way</token> bridge you deployed earlier.
trans-unit.target: With this configuration, all the messages processed by the agreement are routed to the <token>one-way</token> bridge you deployed earlier.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Route</embeddedLabel> page, under <embeddedLabel>Message Suspension Settings</embeddedLabel>, enter the <embeddedLabel>Transport Type</embeddedLabel> as <embeddedLabel>Azure Service Bus</embeddedLabel>, and then enter the following values:
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Route</embeddedLabel> page, under <embeddedLabel>Message Suspension Settings</embeddedLabel>, enter the <embeddedLabel>Transport Type</embeddedLabel> as <embeddedLabel>Azure Service Bus</embeddedLabel>, and then enter the following values:

trans-unit.source: Set the route destination type to <embeddedLabel>BasicHttpRelay</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Set the route destination type to <embeddedLabel>BasicHttpRelay</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Enter the <token>sb2</token> namespace, issuer name, and issuer key.
trans-unit.target: Enter the <token>sb2</token> namespace, issuer name, and issuer key.

trans-unit.source: Enter the endpoint URL where a relay receiver service is already running.
trans-unit.target: Enter the endpoint URL where a relay receiver service is already running.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, specify this as <userInput>Suspend</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, specify this as <userInput>Suspend</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: So, the complete URL where a failed message is sent is <codeInline>http://<legacyItalic>%%amp;lt;servicebus_namespace%%amp;gt;</legacyItalic>.servicebus.windows.net/Suspend</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: So, the complete URL where a failed message is sent is <codeInline>http://<legacyItalic>%%amp;lt;servicebus_namespace%%amp;gt;</legacyItalic>.servicebus.windows.net/Suspend</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: To specify the send settings
trans-unit.target: To specify the send settings

trans-unit.source: From the agreements page, select the <embeddedLabel>Send Settings</embeddedLabel> tab.
trans-unit.target: From the agreements page, select the <embeddedLabel>Send Settings</embeddedLabel> tab.

trans-unit.source: Even though this tutorial does not cover the send side of the agreement, you must specify the minimum default values to successfully deploy the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Even though this tutorial does not cover the send side of the agreement, you must specify the minimum default values to successfully deploy the agreement.

trans-unit.source: Retain the default values <embeddedLabel>Inbound URL</embeddedLabel>, <embeddedLabel>Transform</embeddedLabel>, and <embeddedLabel>Batching</embeddedLabel> tabs.
trans-unit.target: Retain the default values <embeddedLabel>Inbound URL</embeddedLabel>, <embeddedLabel>Transform</embeddedLabel>, and <embeddedLabel>Batching</embeddedLabel> tabs.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Protocol</embeddedLabel> tab, under <embeddedLabel>Schemas</embeddedLabel>, enter the following values:
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Protocol</embeddedLabel> tab, under <embeddedLabel>Schemas</embeddedLabel>, enter the following values:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: For <embeddedLabel>Version</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: For <embeddedLabel>Version</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: Set this to <embeddedLabel>00401</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: Set this to <embeddedLabel>00401</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: For <embeddedLabel>Transaction Type (ST01)</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: For <embeddedLabel>Transaction Type (ST01)</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: Set this to <embeddedLabel>850 – Purchase Order</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: Set this to <embeddedLabel>850 – Purchase Order</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: For <embeddedLabel>Schema</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: For <embeddedLabel>Schema</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: Set this to <embeddedLabel>X12_00401_850</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Set this to <embeddedLabel>X12_00401_850</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Transport</embeddedLabel> section, under <embeddedLabel>Transport Settings</embeddedLabel>, enter the following values:
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Transport</embeddedLabel> section, under <embeddedLabel>Transport Settings</embeddedLabel>, enter the following values:

trans-unit.source: Set the <embeddedLabel>Transport Type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>FTP/S</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Set the <embeddedLabel>Transport Type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>FTP/S</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Enter the required values for the FTP transport.
trans-unit.target: Enter the required values for the FTP transport.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Transport</embeddedLabel> section, under <embeddedLabel>Message Suspension Settings</embeddedLabel>, enter the following values:
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Transport</embeddedLabel> section, under <embeddedLabel>Message Suspension Settings</embeddedLabel>, enter the following values:

trans-unit.source: Set the <embeddedLabel>Transport Type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Azure Service Bus</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Set the <embeddedLabel>Transport Type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Azure Service Bus</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Set the route destination type to <embeddedLabel>BasicHttpRelay</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Set the route destination type to <embeddedLabel>BasicHttpRelay</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Specify the <token>sb2</token> namespace, issuer name, and issuer key.
trans-unit.target: Specify the <token>sb2</token> namespace, issuer name, and issuer key.

trans-unit.source: Specify the endpoint URL where a relay receiver service is already running.
trans-unit.target: Specify the endpoint URL where a relay receiver service is already running.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, specify this as <userInput>Suspend</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, specify this as <userInput>Suspend</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: So, the complete URL where a failed message is sent is <codeInline>http://<legacyItalic>%%amp;lt;servicebus_namespace%%amp;gt;</legacyItalic>.servicebus.windows.net/Send_Failure</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: So, the complete URL where a failed message is sent is <codeInline>http://<legacyItalic>%%amp;lt;servicebus_namespace%%amp;gt;</legacyItalic>.servicebus.windows.net/Send_Failure</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Deploy Agreement</embeddedLabel> to deploy the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Deploy Agreement</embeddedLabel> to deploy the agreement.

trans-unit.source: Once the agreement is deployed, to test the solution, you can go ahead and drop a test PO 850 message in the folder on the FTP server that you specified as part of the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Once the agreement is deployed, to test the solution, you can go ahead and drop a test PO 850 message in the folder on the FTP server that you specified as part of the agreement.

trans-unit.source: More details on how to test the solution are provided in the next topic, <link xlink:href="c0b7c696-df2d-4c1a-95de-1369b8557eef" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Test the Solution</link>.
trans-unit.target: More details on how to test the solution are provided in the next topic, <link xlink:href="c0b7c696-df2d-4c1a-95de-1369b8557eef" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Test the Solution</link>.
